tool_description: Helps you verify the identity of Merchant at any point, be it onboarding or a routine compliance check.
name: Merchant Verification Solutions
title: Merchant Verification Solutions

api_list.name: Establishment Verification
api_list.description: This API that takes the epfo registered establishment code / establishment name as an input and returns the relevant information about the establishment.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://merchant-verification-solutions.p.rapidapi.com/v3/tasks/sync/verify_with_source/establishment_epfo"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "merchant-verification-solutions.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://merchant-verification-solutions.p.rapidapi.com/v3/tasks/sync/verify_with_source/establishment_epfo"

api_list.name: Udyog Aadhar
api_list.description:
IDfy’s Udyog Aadhaar API allows you to verify details of Udyog Aadhaar (also known as Aadhaar for Business). Clients want to validate that the Udyog Aadhaar certificates that their customers have sent to them are valid, due to the following reasons:

Udyog Aadhaar validity and verification is a regulatory requirement in some domains (like MSME lending)
Clients do not want fraudulent merchants with fake documents to onboard on their system.

With the udyog aadhaar verification API, we aim to provide our clients a mechanism to verify merchant’s Udyog aadhaar numbers from the udyog aadhaar govt source. The API accepts a UAM number and responses with details about the Name of the Business, Major activity, category type, expiration date, address, NIC, etc.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://merchant-verification-solutions.p.rapidapi.com/v3/tasks/sync/verify_with_source/udyog_aadhaar"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "merchant-verification-solutions.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:

api_list.name: IBBI Verification API
api_list.description: IBBI or Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India was established on 1st October, 2016 under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016 (Code). It is a key pillar that is responsible for implementation of the Code that consolidates and amends the laws relating to reorganization and insolvency resolution of corporate persons, partnership firms and individuals in a time bound manner. IDfy’s IBBI Verification API will enable you to understand if the corporation is under bankruptcy.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://merchant-verification-solutions.p.rapidapi.com/v3/tasks/sync/verify_with_source/ind_ibbi_verify"

        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)

api_list.name: Importer-Exporter Code Verification
api_list.description:
The Importer -Exporter Code (IEC) is a key business identification number which is mandatory for Exports or Imports. No person shall make any import or export except under an IEC Number granted by the DGFT. In case of import or export of services or technology, the IEC shall be required only when the service or technology provider is taking benefits under the Foreign Trade Policy or is dealing with specified services or technologies.

IDfy’s IEC / ROC API allows you to verify the IEC Number of the importer / exporter
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://merchant-verification-solutions.p.rapidapi.com/v3/tasks/sync/verify_with_source/roc_iec"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "merchant-verification-solutions.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Udhyam Aadhar Verification
api_list.description:
IDfy’s Udyam Aadhaar API allows you to verify details of Udyam Aadhaar (also known as Aadhaar for Business). In 2020, the GOI deprecated the Udyog Aadhaar and instructed all the 1.05 Cr merchants who had registered on Udyog to migrate to Udyam. While the migration has been slow, Udyam Aadhaar is likely to see high usage in the near future. Clients want to validate that the Udyam Aadhaar certificates that their customers have sent to them are valid, due to the following reasons:

Udyam Aadhaar validity and verification is a regulatory requirement in some domains (like MSME lending)
Clients do not want fraudulent merchants with fake documents to onboard on their system.
With the Udyam aadhaar verification API, we aim to provide our clients a mechanism to verify merchant’s Udyam aadhaar numbers from the Udyam aadhaar govt source. The API accepts a UAM number and responses with details about the Name of the Business, Major activity, category type, expiration date, address, NIC, etc.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://merchant-verification-solutions.p.rapidapi.com/v3/tasks/sync/verify_with_source/udyam_aadhaar"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "merchant-verification-solutions.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
